page.title: 09OIL SUPPLY BOATS
page.content: Oil supply vesssels have become a very familar site in the sea around Aberdeen.Instantly recognisable by their specially designed high bow and low broad stern.This enables anchoring from the rear which facilitates easier loading onto the rig,and towing the rig if required.Some only berth in the harbour for a matter of hours.Once loaded its straight back out to the rig,usually making three journeys a week.They are mainly of Scandinavian or benelux origin.Only a very small percentage are British.They literally transport everything from food and water to paper,pipes and drill bits. One exception are personnel who are flown out by helicopters.Working on these boats can be very hazerdous. heavy seas with 80 foot swells occur and seamen can be crushed when a boat and rig collide in high,stormy sea.
